item.title: Poems
item.description: Most of these poems were written during fall 2023 for the class 21W.771, taught by Prof. Erica Funkhouser. The painting on the cover is L’Estaque by Paul CÃ©zanne. Vertigo From dizzying heights, the earth we once knew drifted into a sea of whispers. Not snow-capped peaks, nor treacherous straits could stop us anymore. We flew over the town in half-light. Soft shadows scaled the low walls. The place where every road began.
